item.title: Whats wrong with my command?
item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

[quote=“blitz_9100, post:4, topic:148057”]sorry add this too

[code]
public void createNewTileObject1(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType, int height)
{
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(y - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(x - (mapRegionX * 8));

	outStream.createFrame(151);
	//outStream.writeByteA(((x&7) << 4) + (y&7));
            outStream.writeByteA(0);
	outStream.writeWordBigEndian(typeID);
	outStream.writeByteS((tileObjectType<<2) +(orientation&3));
}

[/code][/quote]

blitz i have a similar problem
whenever i try to spawn an object it says bad object id.
do i need to completely erase it and put yours in?
help would be appreciated

Read full topic

sorry add this too

public void createNewTileObject1(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType, int height)
	{
		outStream.createFrame(85);
                outStream.writeByteC(y - (mapRegionY * 8));
                outStream.writeByteC(x - (mapRegionX * 8));

		outStream.createFrame(151);
		//outStream.writeByteA(((x&7) << 4) + (y&7));
                outStream.writeByteA(0);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(typeID);
		outStream.writeByteS((tileObjectType<<2) +(orientation&3));
	}

item.title: Whats wrong with my command?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

here you can use mine plus ill throw in my objectmapper free 

		if (command.startsWith("poh")) {
						try {
							int objectid = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4,9));
							int type = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(10,12));
							int face = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13,14));
							int height = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(15,16));
							makeGlobalObject1(absX, absY,objectid, face,type,height);
							POHMapper(objectid,face,type,height);
							} catch(Exception e) {
							sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::poh 00001 10 1 1");
						}
		}

the command goes

::poh 00001 10 1 1
::poh objectid(5) Objecttype(2) face(1) hieght(1)

objectMapper method

public void POHMapper(int objectid,int face,int type, int height) {
		try {
		BufferedWriter bufferedwriter;
		bufferedwriter = null;
      		bufferedwriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("objects.txt", true));
       		bufferedwriter.write((new StringBuilder()).append("makeGlobalObject1(").append(absX).append(",").append(absY).append(",").append(objectid).append(",").append(face).append(",").append(type).append(",").append(height).append(");").toString());
        	bufferedwriter.newLine();
		bufferedwriter.flush();
		} catch(Exception e) {
		sendMessage("PohMapper failed.");
		}
}

o youll need my makeglobalobjects1 methode too

public void makeGlobalObject1(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType, int height){ //Makes Global objects
				for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
					if(p != null){
						client person = (client)p;
					if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){
						if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
						person.createNewTileObject1(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType, height);
						}
					}
				}
			}
		}

all you have to do is add it in

good luck with this

o the object mapper writes the objects you type to clean that out if your gonna use that alot(objects.txt)

Read full topic

{

	try
	{

                    int orient = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13,14));
                    int type = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(15));
                    AddGlobalObj(absX, absY, object, orient, type);
            //createNewTileObject(absX, absY, object, orient, type);
	}
	catch(Exception e) 
	{
		sendMessage("Bad object ID"); 
	}	
}[/code]
